node.title: Bus drivers racially abused, threatened by teenagers
node.description: Tauranga bus drivers are facing racial abuse and death threats from local school boys hanging out at the city's transport hub, First Union says. Audio

node.title: $40k of electronics stolen from Auckland schools
node.description: Three west Auckland schools have had electronics stolen, prompting a police investigation.

node.title: Hubble telescope finds largest comet ever discovered
node.description: The comet is bigger than Rhode Island and could be "as big as 85 miles across," according to NASA.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 16 further deaths, 519 in hospital, 9563 new cases
node.description: There have been 9563 new community cases of Covid-19 reported today, along with 16 further deaths.

node.title: 'Up the creek': Builder blasts council over long wait for house inspections
node.description: Some builders are threatening to bypass council inspections due to "absurd" delays in getting staff on site.

node.title: Pair charged with firearms offences after West Auckland standoff
node.description: A man and woman have been charged with firearms offences after a standoff with police in West Auckland this morning.

node.title: What Americans pay in property taxes in every U.S. state
node.description: Buying a home? Don't overlook the impact of local property taxes on your budget, experts advise.

node.title: Dismay at secret NZ probe into Australia troops
node.description: A former Australian governor-general says he is "dismayed" at the revelation that NZ secretly investigated torture allegations against soldiers under his command in East Timor in 1999.

node.title: Ukraine war could worsen crises in Yemen and Afghanistan
node.description: While the world focuses on Ukraine, the UN warns humanitarian needs elsewhere in the world are also growing.

node.title: Phoenix win on the eve of their return home
node.description: The Wellington Phoenix have further entrenched themselves in the top six of the A-League before their long-awaited return home.

node.title: Greymouth hill report under fire
node.description: A proposal in the Te Tai o Poutini Plan for a land instability hazard area - cutting a swathe along the coastal hills behind Greymouth - has come under fire at the West Coast Regional Council.

node.title: Cost of living, soaring food prices: 'This is a survival issue'
node.description: Dramatically rising food prices are leading to a record number of families facing dire situations, according to a community non-profit organisation. Audio

node.title: Boaties urged to take care after girl's leg hit by propeller
node.description: Maritime New Zealand is urging boaties to know the risks after a child was seriously injured while out boating in Queenstown.

node.title: Cannabis farm gets $13m grant: 'New generation coming into agriculture'
node.description: The government has given a cash injection to the country's largest medicinal cannabis grower, saying it could become as successful as the wine industry.

node.title: Jury deliberates in case of British ISIS militant accused of kidnapping
node.description: Jury deliberates in case of El Shafee Elsheikh, one of three British men accused of brutal ISIS hostage-taking scheme.

node.title: Kentucky lawmakers override governor's veto of abortion ban
node.description: Abortion-rights groups claim the law is "impossible to comply with," making it a "de facto abortion ban" in violation of Roe v. Wade.

node.title: Pay equity: Health Minister says nurses' union no longer putting deal to vote
node.description: Health Minister Andrew Little says the New Zealand Nurses Organisation has decided not to put a pay equity settlement to its members for a vote.

node.title: Texas Rep. Henry Cuellar is not the target of FBI investigation, attorney says
node.description: Cuellar's home and campaign office were raided in January, but he denied any wrongdoing.

node.title: Orange light setting: SkyCity thrilled but warns time needed to prepare
node.description: SkyCity says the move to the orange traffic light setting is a significant step for the tourism and hospitality industry.

node.title: Manufacturing activity lifts slightly
node.description: BNZ senior economist Doug Steel said growth was being driven by new orders, but manufacturers are feeling the heat on the supply side.

node.title: Council consults on Masterton's proposed $30 million facility amid ratepayer disquiet
node.description: The next step in the consultation process for Masterton's proposed $30 million civic facility is on its way.

node.title: 'Kiwis not leaving' NZ spend cash and keep regional businesses humming
node.description: South Taranaki appears well placed to bounce back from Covid-19 after dodging the worst of the disruption caused by the virus.

node.title: Watch live: Dr Ashley Bloomfield gives Covid-19 update
node.description: It's the first day for the country in orange traffic light setting and Director-General of Health Dr Ashley Bloomfield is giving a Covid-19 update.

node.title: Masks remain key defence in orange setting - Hipkins
node.description: Covid-19 Response Minister Chris Hipkins is continuing to champion mask wearing, despite some requirements being loosened. Audio

node.title: Trump PAC gives $500K to group to defeat Georgia's GOP governor
node.description: He's backing former Sen. David Perdue in his primary challenge against Gov. Brian Kemp.

node.title: Manufacturer keen to find NZ source of hemp fibre for clothing
node.description: A New Zealand clothing brand spinning knitwear out of merino and hemp is hoping to drum up demand for a hemp fibre industry here.

node.title: Netball's Shannon Saunders - here if you need
node.description: 'Here if you need' - it's a reassuring phrase that all netballers know well; four simple words that mean your team-mate has got your back on court.

node.title: Fire and Emergency reviews policies after child sex abuser case
node.description: Fire and Emergency is reviewing its policies after RNZ revealed a firefighter was allowed to remain in his brigade after being convicted of sexually assaulting his young son.

node.title: Man who allegedly assaulted Sikh men in NYC charged with hate crimes
node.description: Three Sikh men have been attacked in the New York City neighborhood in the past week, according to the Sikh Coalition.

node.title: IPCA finds Auckland police officer mishandled money
node.description: The police watchdog has found a North Shore officer mishandled cash that was handed in to their station.
